item.title: [rs2] auto typer 0.4
item.dc:creator: @Smartzkid Smartzkid
item.description:
@Smartzkid wrote:

instead of using sendkeys, you should use keydown/keyup…alot less detectable

and here’s a shift holding procedure - made by ron - if you ever want to make it do effects

// Procedure Shift and then the byte to press Shift and another key. // by Ron. Example... Shift(186); would send a colon. Procedure Shift(b : byte); Begin Wait(20+Random(30)); KeyDown(16) Wait(20+Random(30)); KeyDown(b); Wait(20+Random(30)); KeyUp(b) Wait(20+Random(30)); KeyUp(16); Wait(20+Random(30)); End;

And heres a talking procedure…forget where i got it…maybe i wrote? idk…

Procedure Autotalk(Message1: String); begin t:=1; repeat t:= t + 1; waittime:= 200+random(200); //might want to change these... SendKeys(StrGet(Message1, t)); wait(waittime); until(t>=Length(Msg)); SendKeys(chr(13)); end;

edits: some small fixes to the codes

Read full topic

item.title: [rs2] auto typer 0.4
item.dc:creator: @x_m4gickz_x x m4gickz x
item.description:
@x_m4gickz_x wrote:

[scar]

{made by X M4gickz X no copying!!!} {drag crosshair into window then
go to the window and hold Ctrl+alt+r to start script}

program autotalker;

const
Message1=‘green:shake:i like cheese… lol’; //what you want person to say

procedure autotalk;
begin
wait(3000+random(500))
sendKeys(message1 + chr (13))
wait(1000)
end;

begin
repeat
autotalk;
until(false)
end.

[/scar]

tell me how it goes report anything wrong
